resources.string: The main app logo displayed on a logo screen.

Values based on the 2022 Veteran Affairs compensation tables. The calculator estimates your basic and special monthly compensation (SMC) rates. For further details and information about other benefits please refer to www.va.gov. Estimates only, see Terms for more information.
Use this form to enter your information about your dependents. Learn more about who qualifies as a dependent here.
Having a spouse increases your compensation rate.
How many children under the age of 18 do you have?
Veterans qualify for additional monthly compensation if they have dependent children.
How many children between the ages 18 and 23 do you have in a qualifying school program?

If you have children attending college you may be eligible for an additional benefit added to your monthly compensation. For details about other educational assistance programs that won\'t impact your monthly compensation, such as the GI Bill, click here.

Use this form to add Vietnam and Korean Veterans\' children who have spina bifida and women Vietnam Veterans\' children with certain other birth defects. Click here for more information and to see if you qualify.\n\nClick the add button to add information about a child with birth defects.
How many dependent parents do you have?
You will qualify for additional compensation if at least one of your parents are dependent on you.
Do you require daily aid and attendance?
This benefit is available for veterans who need help performing every day activities. Find out if you qualify for an Aid and Attendance benefit here.
WARNING: Pressing this button will remove all current calculations. This action is final and not reversible.

This application was created with the sole intention to help the veterans of the United States calculate their disability income with ease. With this app you can input your dependents as well as your marrital status, along with other helpful information, then the app will take care of the rest!

The creation of this app could not have been possible without the hard work and knowledge of some of the best students attending Valecia College. Sarah Gillis, Gabriel Corbin, Publio Samayoa, Chance Giordano, Heloiza Naemy Sadoyama Camargo, and Jensy Fernandez worked very diligently, day and night, to make sure that this application was created with precision and excellence to make sure that it works great so you can work less.
We hope you enjoy the App!

Disability ratings are based on the severity of your disability. The VA express this rating as a percentage, representing how much your disability decreases your overall health and ability to function.\n\nThen, they use your disability rating to determine your disability compensation rate, so they can calculate how much money you’ll receive from them each month.
How does the VA determine combined VA disability ratings?

Calculating your combined disability rating involves more than adding up your individual ratings. That’s why your combined rating may be different from the sum of your individual ratings. The VA takes percentages of percentages.\n\nFor example: Let’s say you are a veteran with two 10% ratings. The first rating will be 10% of 100 (which is 10%), leaving you with a 90% “healthy“ percentage. The second 10 rating will be 10% of the 90% (healthy percentage), which is 9%. The combined rating would be 19%. It is then rounded up or down. In this case, it would be rounded to 20%.

WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT? Android Space does not collect any data from users through the VA Math Calculator, which means there is no collecting, storing, transferring, sharing, or selling of any user data internally or with third parties, including domestic or internationally. We do not use any tracking methods. We do not utilize any form of logins, including social logins.
HOW CAN YOU CONTACT US ABOUT THIS NOTICE? If you have any questions or comments about this notice, please submit an email to inquries@androidspace.com.
